interacts: As a major phytohormone regulating abiotic stress responses, ABA interacts with the JA signaling pathway to induce plant physiological responses to mitigate the effects of various abiotic stress factors.
Consistent with previous results, MYC2 interacts not only with JAZ1 but also with JAZ3 and JAZ9.
activates: Here we demonstrate that ORCA3 specifically binds to and activates gene expression via a previously characterized jasmonate- and elicitor-responsive element (JERE) in the promoter of the terpenoid indole alkaloid biosynthetic gene Strictosidine synthase (Str).

MYC2 Is Required for the Suppression of Microbe-Associated Molecular Patterns (MAMPs)-Activated Defenses by Pathogenic and Beneficial Microbes.Flg22, a conserved MAMP, activates MYB51-regulated indole glucosinolate biosynthesis, which is required for callose formation and CYP71A12-mediated biosynthesis of the phytoalexin camalexin in Arabidopsis roots.
inhibits: Conversely, MYC2 inhibits salicylic acid (SA) regulation of abiotic stress response genes.
Our study, however, does not rule out the possibility that COR also inhibits the expression or the activity of MeSA esterase, which converts MeSA back to SA.
produces: Pseudomonas syringae produces coronatine, a toxin that mimics the plant hormone jasmonic acid isoleucine and promotes opening of stomata for bacterial entry, bacterial growth in the apoplast, systemic susceptibility, and disease symptoms.
Pyrethrum (Tanacetum cinerariifolium) produces insecticidal compounds known as pyrethrins.
